headline: CES 2026: A look at this year's most offbeat gadgets & products
summary: CES 2026 took place this week, where a number of tech companies announced new projects and unveiled new products, such as Nvidia's (NVDA) Alpamayo open-source model to train and improve autonomous driving programs, Qualcomm's (QCOM) Snapdragon X Plus 2 artificial intelligence (AI) chip for PCs, and more. The event also showcased some more offbeat AI offerings. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley takes a look at some of the strangest AI innovations we saw at this year's CES. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

content.title: CES 2026: A look at this year's most offbeat gadgets & products

The event also showcased some more offbeat AI offerings. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley takes a look at some of the strangest AI innovations we saw at this year's CES.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.
